Module Contents

class django.db.models.fields.files.FieldFile(instance, field, name)[source]

Bases: django.core.files.base.File, django.db.models.utils.AltersData

A mixin class used to forward file methods to an underlaying file object. The internal file object has to be called “file”:

class FileProxy(FileProxyMixin):
    def __init__(self, file):
        self.file = file

class django.db.models.fields.files.FileDescriptor(field)[source]

Bases: django.db.models.query_utils.DeferredAttribute

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)

generate_filename(instance, filename)[source]

Apply (if callable) or prepend (if a string) upload_to to the filename, then delegate further processing of the name to the storage backend. Until the storage layer, all file paths are expected to be Unix style (with forward slashes).

class django.db.models.fields.files.ImageFileDescriptor(field)[source]

Bases: FileDescriptor

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

class django.db.models.fields.files.ImageFieldFile(file, name=None)[source]

Bases: django.core.files.images.ImageFile, FieldFile

A mixin for use alongside django.core.files.base.File, which provides additional features for dealing with images.

class django.db.models.fields.files.ImageField(verbose_name=None, name=None, width_field=None, height_field=None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: FileField

attr_class[source]

contribute_to_class(cls, name, **kwargs)[source]
update_dimension_fields(instance, force=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Update field’s width and height fields, if defined.

This method is hooked up to model’s post_init signal to update dimensions after instantiating a model instance. However, dimensions won’t be updated if the dimensions fields are already populated. This avoids unnecessary recalculation when loading an object from the database.

Dimensions can be forced to update with force=True, which is how ImageFileDescriptor.__set__ calls this method.

formfield(**kwargs)[source]
